excerpts:
We ordered the following:
- Falafel Sandwich: Delicious.
I loved the mixed flavors of Falafel and the veggies.
I ate the whole thing within minutes.
falafel sandwich.author: Ani J.
falafel sandwich.review:
I was attending Oracle Open World last week and found this place near the Moscone Center for lunch. The ambiance is very modern and we were seated right away. 

The menu has extensive vegetarian options. We ordered the following:
- Falafel Sandwich: Delicious. I loved the mixed flavors of Falafel and the veggies. I ate the whole thing within minutes. 
- Falafel Rice Bowl: OMG - the rice is so soft and delicious. It's an amazing combination and you can't go wrong with this one. 
- Side of Small hummus and Babaganush: the bread is soft and warm and I loved these spreads. 

I wish I had time to eat there again as I wanted to try the other options as well. I highly recommend this place. I wish they had a branch here in DC as well :)

excerpts: so I decided to try falafel sandwich.
Man that's probably the best falafel I have ever tried.
Crunchy top and super soft inside.
I am definitely a fan, if you are reading this review right now, imagine the best falafel you have ever tasted, Oren's is better than that.
falafel sandwich.author: Qasim Z.
falafel sandwich.review: Loved the taste. This was my first visit so I decided to try falafel sandwich. Man that's probably the best falafel I have ever tried. Crunchy top and super soft inside. I am definitely a fan, if you are reading this review right now, imagine the best falafel you have ever tasted, Oren's is better than that.

excerpts: The falafel sandwich was great.
Sweet potatoes fries were okay but the accompanying sauce/spicy mayo was amazing.
Would highly recommend to try it more.
Food was definitely tasty but not sure if the serving portion was worth it.
Would recommend for great tasting food.
falafel sandwich.author: Nilesh C.
falafel sandwich.review: Did a quick take out at Oren's Hummus. The falafel sandwich was great. Sweet potatoes fries were okay but the accompanying sauce/spicy mayo was amazing. Would highly recommend to try it more. Food was definitely tasty but not sure if the serving portion was worth it. Would recommend for great tasting food.

excerpts: Fantastic falafel sandwich, and loved the various eggplant dips!
The smoky Romanian one was delicious.
It's quite the happening place - busy, lively, and effervescent service.
Great place to eat as a lone diner!
falafel sandwich.author: Steven B.
falafel sandwich.review: Fantastic falafel sandwich, and loved the various eggplant dips!  The smoky Romanian one was delicious.  It's quite the happening place - busy, lively, and effervescent service.  Great place to eat as a lone diner!

excerpts: We had Hummus with Lamb, Hummus with Mushroom, Chicken Schnitzel, Bourekas, Romanian Eggplant and Falafel along with Wheat Pitas.
Great flavors and portions.
Must visit if you are around.
chicken schnitzel.author: Manoj B.
chicken schnitzel.review:
One of the best Mediterranean restaurants I have been to lately...

The service was great considering it was a weekday lunch.

And the food - just amazing! 

We had Hummus with Lamb, Hummus with Mushroom, Chicken Schnitzel, Bourekas, Romanian Eggplant and Falafel along with Wheat Pitas. Great flavors and portions. Must visit if you are around.

excerpts:
*Chicken Schnitzel: 
Breaded and fried chicken breast with hummus, tomato, cucumber, and pickles, White Pita ($13.95)
*Quick Fried Cauliflower Florets: With pesto labane ($7)
*Hummus: Served with Whole Wheat Pita, Small (8 oz.)
Includes 1 pita ($6)
chicken schnitzel.author: Elena N.
chicken schnitzel.review:
I've been wanting to try Oren's Hummus for a while. When it popped up as a weekly office lunch option, I figured it was my chance. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar on Friday, October 12th around 12:15pm.

*Chicken Schnitzel: Breaded and fried chicken breast with hummus, tomato, cucumber, and pickles, White Pita ($13.95)
*Quick Fried Cauliflower Florets: With pesto labane ($7)
*Hummus: Served with Whole Wheat Pita, Small (8 oz.): Includes 1 pita ($6)
*Bourekas: Cheese ($1.95), Mushrooms ($1.95)

The best dish out of the three was the cauliflower. Great texture and flavor. Everyone in the office enjoyed it. And it was a huge serving. The schnitzel was okay. Not much filling to pita ratio. I found it too bready. I got the side of hummus and bourekas. The hummus was a good amount. And it was dense. But I found the hummus to be too thick. And I didn't know it was going to be plain, so it didn't have much flavor. It was fine when I added some oil based salad dressing I had at work, but by itself, I didn't really care for it. I did eat some with the bourekas which wasn't too bad. Out of the two pastries, I liked the mushroom one more. It had more flavor with the earthiness of the mushrooms. The cheese one was bland. Not much cheese and too much dough. I kinda ate the inside and discarded the rest.

Maybe I ordered the wrong things, but this just wasn't up my alley. Everything was rather tasteless. If it ever pops up again, I'll give it another go (and probably order something meat centric), but based on everything I ordered, I wasn't impressed. I would have rated them 2 or 2.5 stars, but the cauliflower bumped them up to 3. It saved my meal.

excerpts: I ended up getting the Chicken Schnitzel with a side of sweet potato fries.
The chicken schnitzel was perfection, the breaded chicken was so crispy yet moist!
The chicken was cut into square pieces and mixed with hummas, tomato and cucumber.
Almost similar to a chicken salad sandwich smacked in between pita bread.
But their Chicken Schnitzel is what would make me return!
chicken schnitzel.author: Amelia L.
chicken schnitzel.review:
During a lunch break with a few co workers, with limited time and all the other places packed, we decided to go to a less busy restaurant but with still amazing reviews! The verdict led us to here! So glad it did because the food was more than impressive! 

I ended up getting the Chicken Schnitzel with a side of sweet potato fries. The chicken schnitzel was perfection, the breaded chicken was so crispy yet moist! The chicken was cut into square pieces and mixed with hummas, tomato and cucumber. Almost similar to a chicken salad sandwich smacked in between pita bread. Hungry just thinking about it. 

I would have given this place 5 stars but honestly wasn't a fan of their sweet potato fries, a little disappointed, maybe it was it was too thick and not crispy enough...

But their Chicken Schnitzel is what would make me return!

excerpts: I always get the chicken schnitzel pita sandwich which usually fills me up.
Pretty pricey, but you definitely get great service and good quality pita / hummus!
chicken schnitzel.author: Annie S.
chicken schnitzel.review: I'm happy that there's an Oren's Hummus in SF now! All the Oren's have such nice and classy decor. You can choose to either sit down and eat or order food to go (there's a register for that on the right side of the restaurant). I always get the chicken schnitzel pita sandwich which usually fills me up. Pretty pricey, but you definitely get great service and good quality pita / hummus!

excerpts: I got the Chicken Schnitzel pita sandwich the first time round and the mushroom hummus bowl the second time.
The food was great, as is always the case with Orens.
chicken schnitzel.author: Gaurav K.
chicken schnitzel.review:
This place is da bomb. I've been a fan since I visited their Palo Alto and Mountain View restaurant years ago and couldn't wait to visit once I heard they were opening up 2 blocks from my work place in San Francisco. 

I got the Chicken Schnitzel pita sandwich the first time round and the mushroom hummus bowl the second time. The food was great, as is always the case with Orens. I'm waiting to go back the third and the fourth and the fifth time so that I can try all the other items on the menu (Chicken skewers, the rice bowl etc.)

If you're in the neighborhood, just go to Orens. Don't think.

excerpts: We got the rice bowl with chicken, a side skewer of chicken, the chicken schnitzel, and the hummus cauliflower.
The service was friendly and efficient.
chicken schnitzel.author: David O.
chicken schnitzel.review: Super-tasty, no wait around 8:30 on a Saturday evening. We got the rice bowl with chicken, a side skewer of chicken, the chicken schnitzel, and the hummus cauliflower. The service was friendly and efficient.

excerpts: I got the schnitzel de noir which came with a side of mashed sweet potatoes which were a little dense.
My OJ/CJ (carrot juice)
50/50 combo was refreshing after a sweltering hot day.
The pastry filled with cheese was not flaky like I was expecting it to be
but I can't complain because it was still good.
If I am ever in the area and want Israeli fast casual, I'd definitely stop by Oren's.
schnitzel de noir.author: Zain R.
schnitzel de noir.review: Oren's is a cute place with friendly staff and really good food. I got the schnitzel de noir which came with a side of mashed sweet potatoes which were a little dense. My OJ/CJ (carrot juice) 50/50 combo was refreshing after a sweltering hot day. The pastry filled with cheese was not flaky like I was expecting it to be but I can't complain because it was still good. If I am ever in the area and want Israeli fast casual, I'd definitely stop by Oren's.

excerpts: I decided to order the rice bowl, and WOW, was I glad I did!
This bowl came loaded with turmeric-spiced basmati rice, simmered tomatoes, garlic, onions, mint, and parsley, and was topped with chicken.
It was so fresh and the flavor was fantastic.
rice bowl.author: Aimee K.
rice bowl.review:
This is a great, great lunch option in SF. I'm always a huge fan of anywhere that takes reservations since I'm often lunching with a big group, and Oren's was more than accommodating. We were seated immediately and had great service during our visit.

The lunch vibe at Oren's is lively and busy, and the natural light of this place will definitely wash away the morning work slump. The menu is large, and everything is healthy. You truly can't lose here. I decided to order the rice bowl, and WOW, was I glad I did! This bowl came loaded with turmeric-spiced basmati rice, simmered tomatoes, garlic, onions, mint, and parsley, and was topped with chicken. It was so fresh and the flavor was fantastic. I'm always looking for more ways to get extra turmeric, so this was a big win for me.

I'll definitely be back. This is now in my SF lunch rotation!

excerpts: I decided to have the rice bowl with a chicken kebab.
They sold me on a Turkish coffee, which I had never had before.
The coffee was a small serving and it has some gooey residue at the bottom of it.
The chicken rice was good.
I had the tahini sauce.
And they have two other sauces.
It was all good.
I took half of the dish for later.
I had the complimentary cole slaw and that was good.
The service was really nice and it was comfortable.
For some reason, I kept getting rice everywhere around me and had to clean up.
Anyhow, it was fun.
The waitress/hostess was from Macedonia.
This is Middle Eastern food/Israeli/whatever, but it's different from other Turkish falafel spots in SF.
rice bowl.author: Denise C.
rice bowl.review: I went to the Contemporary Jewish Museum today and it was a nice outing. I wanted to eat at Wise Sons, but it closed for the day at like 3pm. So I was thinking about heading to the Ferry Building for Wise Sons, but I walked by Oren's Hummus and saw "Israeli food." So I decided to go in and sit down. It was empty besides maybe one couple at like 3-4pm. I looked at the menu, which does not skimp on price. I decided to have the rice bowl with a chicken kebab. They sold me on a Turkish coffee, which I had never had before. The coffee was a small serving and it has some gooey residue at the bottom of it. The chicken rice was good. I had the tahini sauce. And they have two other sauces. It was all good. I took half of the dish for later. I had the complimentary cole slaw and that was good. The service was really nice and it was comfortable. For some reason, I kept getting rice everywhere around me and had to clean up. Anyhow, it was fun. The waitress/hostess was from Macedonia. This is Middle Eastern food/Israeli/whatever, but it's different from other Turkish falafel spots in SF.

excerpts: - Falafel Rice Bowl:
OMG - the rice is so soft and delicious.
It's an amazing combination and you can't go wrong with this one.
rice bowl.author: Ani J.
rice bowl.review:
I was attending Oracle Open World last week and found this place near the Moscone Center for lunch. The ambiance is very modern and we were seated right away. 

The menu has extensive vegetarian options. We ordered the following:
- Falafel Sandwich: Delicious. I loved the mixed flavors of Falafel and the veggies. I ate the whole thing within minutes. 
- Falafel Rice Bowl: OMG - the rice is so soft and delicious. It's an amazing combination and you can't go wrong with this one. 
- Side of Small hummus and Babaganush: the bread is soft and warm and I loved these spreads. 

I wish I had time to eat there again as I wanted to try the other options as well. I highly recommend this place. I wish they had a branch here in DC as well :)

excerpts: I got the rice bowl with grilled chicken.
Absolutely delicious!
and homemade lemon juice served with a couple sprigs of fresh mint.
rice bowl.author: Ray M.
rice bowl.review:
Oren's, a refreshing idea in downtown San Francisco. Great food, fresh beverages and service.  I got the rice bowl with grilled chicken.  Absolutely delicious! and homemade lemon juice served with a couple sprigs of fresh mint.
They have a very good menu with many items for meat eaters and vegetarians.

Overall, a really nice experience.

excerpts:
So comforting lol

Went back again and we ordered the chicken rice bowl again and the beef skewers.
rice bowl.author: Christina M.
rice bowl.review:
The first time I went here was for a to-go order since I was starving after Dreamforce. I ordered the chicken rice plate and totally melted into the turmeric tomato rice. So comforting lol

Went back again and we ordered the chicken rice bowl again and the beef skewers. For the skewers you get two sides and pita as well. It's good food to share.

Overall this place is a go for a casual yet trendy ambiance and quality food.

excerpts: I got the falafel rice bowl, not a fan.
It was just a bowl of rice some tomatoes and falafel balls.
No sauces or other veggies.
rice bowl.author: Nicki B.
rice bowl.review:
I got the falafel rice bowl, not a fan. It was just a bowl of rice some tomatoes and falafel balls. No sauces or other veggies. The rice was not good at all, and my falafel balls tasted burned.

I was willing to give this place a second chance, wanted to try a sandwich, BUT I also ordered a small side of hummus... they were not kidding when they said small* see picture* and it wasn't even full for $6..... SIX. Honesty, how do you even justify that price. I will say the hummus was good but a tablespoon for $6 not worth it.  

You'd be better off going to Saffron 685 on Townsend.

excerpts: We got the rice bowl as well with falafels, which was definitely the highlight.
rice bowl.author: Alvin W.
rice bowl.review:
Fancy Mediterranean restaurant located in downtown SF. Came here with a couple friends for an early Friday dinner.

First came a complimentary salad for everyone, which was quite a refreshing start to the meal. We then ordered a couple things to share family style. 

We ordered 6 bourekas: 3 mushroom and 3 potatoes. These were small pastries with some filling inside. The pastry itself was perfect -- quite flaky and buttery. The mushroom filling was quite unique and interesting, and the potato one provided a good hearty taste.

Next for the hummus, we ordered a side of babaganoush eggplant hummus, as well as the lamb hummus bowl. This came with some pita bread for the table. The pita was incredibly fresh, warm, and huge, so you can just dip whatever you want on it. I personally didn't like the baganoush eggplant that much -- had a strange peculiar taste that I wasn't used to. The lamb hummus was OK, though I wish there was a bit more meat for the dish.

We also got the shakshuka, which was quite underwhelming and not worth it for the price, as it was basically tomato sauce and eggs. It also didn't seem to go that well with pita, in my opinion. 

We got the rice bowl as well with falafels, which was definitely the highlight. The basmatic rice was very flavorful and falafels were perfect.

Because we were lacking meat, we also got an ala carte beef skewer to share. This was quite small for the price but the beef was very juicy.

Overall, there were some ups and downs in the meal, but the service was great and I would come back again to figure out what is best on the menu.

excerpts: Their rice bowl is of a huge quantity and something I always order.
Also, I would say if you are going out with a vegetarian friend or if you feel like order the sampler , it has everything
rice bowl.author: Ramyata M.
rice bowl.review:
This is one of my favorite places to eat. I have been to their different locations multiple times and I must say, I have never ever been disappointed. Their beef hummus is to die for, like you gotta gotta gotta have it and for all my vegetarian friends, the chickpea hummus is good too, so you are covered. 

Their rice bowl is of a huge quantity and something I always order. 
Also, I would say if you are going out with a vegetarian friend or if you feel like order the sampler , it has everything veg and everything is worth it. 

This place is simply amazing. I love the staff, I love the food, I love that it's not complicated here and I am actually salivating as I am writing this review. Go grab some hummus and pita!!

excerpts: I'm waiting to go back the third and the fourth and the fifth time so that I can try all the other items on the menu (Chicken skewers, the rice bowl etc.)
rice bowl.author: Gaurav K.
rice bowl.review:
This place is da bomb. I've been a fan since I visited their Palo Alto and Mountain View restaurant years ago and couldn't wait to visit once I heard they were opening up 2 blocks from my work place in San Francisco. 

I got the Chicken Schnitzel pita sandwich the first time round and the mushroom hummus bowl the second time. The food was great, as is always the case with Orens. I'm waiting to go back the third and the fourth and the fifth time so that I can try all the other items on the menu (Chicken skewers, the rice bowl etc.)

If you're in the neighborhood, just go to Orens. Don't think.

excerpts: Got the chicken rice bowl, and hubby got the beef humus bowl...
DELICIOUS!!!
The pita and the chicken was so soft it just was such a great meal!
Definitely coming back here!!!
rice bowl.author: Sarah B.
rice bowl.review: Got the chicken rice bowl, and hubby got the beef humus bowl... DELICIOUS!!! The pita and the chicken was so soft it just was such a great meal! Definitely coming back here!!!

excerpts: The rice (that comes in the rice bowl) is super yum, cooked with tomato, garlic, and tons of spices.
i had the falafel -- good texture, creamy and crunchy on the outside.
tried a bit of the chicken kebab which was diviiiiiiine.
and the PITA is fluffy!!
and warm! and delicious.
nothing like the thin dry grocery store variety.
rice bowl.author: Ellen G.
rice bowl.review: amazing and thick hummus, good flavor and tahini served in the swoosh as God intended. The rice (that comes in the rice bowl) is super yum, cooked with tomato, garlic, and tons of spices. i had the falafel -- good texture, creamy and crunchy on the outside. tried a bit of the chicken kebab which was diviiiiiiine. and the PITA is fluffy!! and warm! and delicious. nothing like the thin dry grocery store variety.

excerpts: Chicken rice bowl was tasty!
rice bowl.author: Emily B.
rice bowl.review:
Chicken rice bowl was tasty! But I did have a couple chicken bone pieces in my bowl.

Jaffa Hummus IS AWESOME

Topped with a couple walnuts. Chocolate mousse was not moussey. It looked like cold chocolate cream in a bowl with not very well whipped cream. It all tasted good but in the end I had a couple little pieces of walnut shell in mine. Not very pleasant.

excerpts: We got the rice bowl with chicken, a side skewer of chicken, the chicken schnitzel, and the hummus cauliflower.
The service was friendly and efficient.
rice bowl.author: David O.
rice bowl.review: Super-tasty, no wait around 8:30 on a Saturday evening. We got the rice bowl with chicken, a side skewer of chicken, the chicken schnitzel, and the hummus cauliflower. The service was friendly and efficient.

excerpts: We ordered chicken skewer and 2 hummus bowls.
Best flavors
I've tested in a long time.
I've been to Israel and traveled around there and the flavors are genuine , fresh and new.
Was happy to find something near my office because I'm a huge foodie and love trying new things.
I'd recommend this place to everyone wanting to try new fresh flavors.
chicken skewer.author: Konstancia M.
chicken skewer.review: Came here during lunch with my husband and OMG the flavors just blew our minds. We ordered chicken skewer and 2 hummus bowls. Best flavors I've tested in a long time. I've been to Israel and traveled around there and the flavors are genuine , fresh and new. Was happy to find something near my office because I'm a huge foodie and love trying new things. I'd recommend this place to everyone wanting to try new fresh flavors.

excerpts: Their chicken skewer & hummus with beef bowl are my go to!!!
chicken skewer.author: Anna T.
chicken skewer.review: I love this place. Their food & ambiance is great if you are looking for a casual place. Their hummus and meats compliment each other so well & I love their Israeli salad! Their chicken skewer & hummus with beef bowl are my go to!!!

excerpts: I've been here three times and two of the three times the food arrived cold (cold bourekas, very cold chicken skewer).
chicken skewer.author: Vlad S.
chicken skewer.review:
At present, somewhat comically poorly run, but a solid choice in the area since they're open on weekends and evenings in an area otherwise poorly served outside the M-F business hours.

I've been here three times and two of the three times the food arrived cold (cold bourekas, very cold chicken skewer). I think once they figure out the staff and kitchen handoff, they'll be good.

On the plus side, the hummus is solid and you get a complementary consolation marinated cabbage.

excerpts: I ordered the lemonade with mint, original hummus appetizer, and the chicken skewer entree (with cauliflower and Israeli salad as my sides).
A lot of food and so worth it!
chicken skewer.author: Deema A.
chicken skewer.review: Delicious food, beautiful restaurant, polite and attentive staff. I ordered the lemonade with mint, original hummus appetizer, and the chicken skewer entree (with cauliflower and Israeli salad as my sides). A lot of food and so worth it!

excerpts: I got a chicken skewer and some eggplant dip with pita
and I find the eggplant to be pretty bland and the same with the chicken.
The pita felt chalky
almost bit maybe that's the style
chicken skewer.author: Nick R.
chicken skewer.review:
This place looks amazing and the food is definitely got a great presentation to it but the taste is just okay. I got a chicken skewer and some eggplant dip with pita and I find the eggplant to be pretty bland and the same with the chicken. The pita felt chalky almost bit maybe that's the style, it looked fine on the outside. 

All that said they do have this spicy green chutney type thing on each table and it's amazing. Very fresh tasting and I'm going to try and make it at home.
